alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:29PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Scotts Bluff, northwestern Cheyenne, northeastern Kimball, southwestern Morrill and eastern Banner Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 929 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Harrisburg to 17 miles south of Wildcat Hills Campground to near Kimball. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Potter, Dix, Chimney Rock State Park, Harrisburg, Redington, South Bayard Junction and McGrew. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 20 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill; Scotts Bluff
